FuncDef:
The acl-id command binds an ACL to a service scheme.
The undo acl-id command unbinds an ACL from a service scheme. The acl-id command binds an ACL to a service scheme. The undo acl-id command unbinds an ACL from a service scheme. By default, no ACL is bound to a service scheme. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an ACL bound to a service scheme.
The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999.

Deletes the numbers of all ACLs bound to a service scheme.
-

ExtraInfo: After creating a service scheme using the service-scheme (AAA view) command, you can run the acl-id command to bind an ACL to the service scheme. The user assigned with the service scheme will have the ACL rules.
